metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21589 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Security: Privileges). Supported versions that are affected are5.7.39 and prior and 8.0.16 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerabilityallows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocolsto compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized read access to a subset of MySQL Server accessibledata. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.3 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21589` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.40-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
